title: Biden to Travel to United Kingdom, Belgium in June
sub_head: In his first overseas trip as president he will attend the G-7 summit in England
body:
WASHINGTON—President Biden will travel to the United Kingdom and Belgium in June, making his first overseas trip as president amid the coronavirus pandemic, the White House said Friday.
Mr. Biden will attend the Group of Seven summit in Cornwall, England, and hold bilateral meetings with G-7 leaders, including British Prime Minister Boris Johnson. While in Belgium, Mr. Biden will participate in a North Atlantic Treaty Organization summit as well as meetings with the European Union, the White House said.
Mr. Biden has conducted limited travel around the country since his inauguration in January and his first overseas trip will occur later than his recent predecessors’. President Donald Trump made his first overseas trip, which included stops in Saudi Arabia, Israel and Italy, in May 2017. Presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush took their opening foreign trips in February of the first year of their presidencies.
At the G-7 on June 11-13, the White House said, Mr. Biden will emphasize issues such as public health, economic recovery and climate change.
The White House announced the visits on the final day of Mr. Biden’s virtual climate summit with 40 world leaders. Mr. Biden has also signaled he plans to help distribute Covid-19 vaccine doses to U.S. allies and developing countries around the world.
